content.description: The writer wants to combine sentences 11 and 12 (reproduced below) into a single sentence.
content.question: But when the stakes are high, the risks of making biased decisions are simply too great. An example of a high-stakes situation would be when jurors are deliberating a defendant’s fate.Which of the following revisions to the underlined portion of sentences 11 and 12 most effectively accomplishes this goal?

choices.label: high, then the risks of making biased decisions—one example of which would be when jurors are deliberating a defendant’s fate—are simply too great
high, one good example of which is a defendant having his or her fate being deliberated by jurors, the risks of making biased decisions are simply too great
high, such as when jurors are deliberating a defendant’s fate, the risks of making biased decisions are simply too great
high—like a defendant whose fate is being deliberated by jurors—the risks of making biased decisions are simply too great

content.answer: high, such as when jurors are deliberating a defendant’s fate, the risks of making biased decisions are simply too great

skill.text: Skill 8.B: Write sentences that clearly convey ideas and arguments.
